intro: Willoughbya brachiata, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its flowers appear in clusters during the warmer months. Willoughbya brachiata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
